note.desc: Local tradition tells that the monastery was founded in the time of ʿAmda Ṣǝyon (r. 1318-1348) by ʾabuna Abrǝhām (of Qata) (the founder of Koholo Yoḥannǝs).
note.ab: Gadām. At least 10 monks resided in the monastery at the moment of the visit. A nunnery ʾƎndā Māḥṣun, dedicated to Māḥṣanta Māryām, is located further down the valley of river Gǝwā. Ruins of other structures (churches or dwellings of monks?) are visible along the river valley.
Tābots: large unidentified number, including Zarʾa Buruk, Māḥṣanta Māryām, Abrǝhām (of Qata) Kidāna Mǝḥrat, Takla Haymanot, Zion (?), Mary, Yāsāy, Walda Tǝnśāʾe and others.
